Dispute_Type: Dispute over the validity of the March 5, 2004 election results
Legal_Issue: Whether the Appeal Board exceeded its jurisdiction and breached procedural fairness under the Act
Evidence_Assessment: Sufficiency of evidence to be determined within 7 days; hearing to follow within 14 days if allowed
Legal_Rule: Two-step appeal process: (1) determine sufficiency of evidence within 7 days, (2) hold hearing within 14 days if allowed; procedural fairness must be observed
Procedural_Issue: Premature decision on March 15, 2004; inadequate notice for March 23 hearing
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached due to procedural irregularities
Review_Standard: Compliance with statutory procedure and procedural fairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failed: inadequate notice and opportunity to respond
Legal_Framework: Statutory interpretation of the Pelican Lake Election Act
Applicant_Challenge: Appeal Board exceeded jurisdiction and violated procedural fairness
Court_Result: Appeal remitted for re-determination in accordance with the Act
Remedy_Requested: Setting aside of Appeal Boardâ€™s decisions
Outcome: Decisions set aside; case remitted for proper reconsideration
Legal_Provision: Two-step appeal process and procedural fairness requirements
Legal_Provision_Cited: Pelican Lake Election Act provisions on appeals and procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Procedural violations, lack of notice, bias
Applicable_Process: Two-step appeal process under the Act
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of applicants on procedural grounds
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Re-determination of appeal by Appeal Board
Jurisdiction: Under the Pelican Lake Election Act
